00212          *      @param pixelBuffer Pointer to the buffer to receive pixel intensities

00218 
00219         /*! Fills the array with requested pixel values. Uses a small-memory footprint access.  Good for retrieving small parts of the image.
00220          *      @param pixelBuffer Pointer to the buffer to receive the pixel intensities
00221          *      @param startRow The row from which to start copying pixel intensities
00222          *      @param startCol The col from which to start copying pixel intensities
00223          *      @param rowCnt The number of rows of pixel intensities to copy to the buffer
00224          *      @param colCnt The number of columns of pixel intensities to copy to the buffer
00225          *      @return true if the method succeeded
00226          */
00227         bool GetPixels(u_int16_t* pixelBuffer, u_int32_t startRow, u_int32_t startCol, u_int32_t rowCnt, u_int32_t colCnt);
00228 
00229         /*! Gets the range of pixel intensities.
00230          *      @param min Reference to a u_int16_t to receive the min pixel intensity
00231          *      @param max Reference to a u_int16_t to receive the max pixel intensity
00232          *      @return true if the max and min intensities can be returned.
00233          */
00234         bool GetRange(u_int16_t& min, u_int16_t& max);

00236         /*! Get the global grid positions.  Use FGridCoords::FGridCoords(FRegion&) cast constructor to convert to FGridCoords.
00237          *      @return Global grid position.
00238          */
00239         FRegion GetGlobalGrid() const { return globalGrid; }
00240 
00241         /*! Get the global grid status.
00242          *      @return Returns the status of the global grid.  Can be a combination of GridStatus values.
00243          */
00244         u_int32_t GetGlobalGridStatus() const { return globalGridStatus; }
00245 
00246         /*! Has global grid data been set.
00247          *      @return True if there is global grid data.
00248          */
00249         bool HasGlobalGridData() const { return globalGrid.pts.size() > 0; }
00250 
00251         /*! Set the global grid positions. Use FRegion::FRegion(FGridCoords&) cast constructor to convert from FGridCoords.
00252          *      @param gridStatus A combination of the GridStatus flags indicating the status of the global grid.
00253          *      @param grid Global grid position
00254          */
00255         void SetGlobalGrid(u_int32_t gridStatus, FRegion& grid){ globalGridStatus = gridStatus, globalGrid = grid; }
00256 
00257         /*! Get the number of subgrids.
00258          *      @return Number of subgrids
00259          */
00260         int32_t GetSubgridCnt()const { return (int32_t)subgrids.size(); }
00261         /*! Return a subgrid by index.
00262          *      @param index Index of the subgrid to get
00263          *      @return A region defining the subgrid.
00264          */
00265         FRegion GetSubgrid(int32_t index)const { return subgrids.at(index); }
00266         /*! Get the status of a subgrid.
00267          *      @param index Index of the subgrid status to get.
00268          *      @return Returns the status of the subgrid. Can be a combination of GridStatus values.
00269          */
00270         u_int32_t GetSubgridStatus(int32_t index) const { return subgridsStatus.at(index); }
00271 
00272         /*! Add a subgrid.
00273          *      @param status A combination of the GridStatus flags indicating the status of the subgrid grid.
00274          *      @param subgrid Subgrid region to be added.
00275          */
00276         void AddSubgrid(u_int32_t status, const FRegion& subgrid);

00278          */
00279         void ClearSubgrids(){ subgrids.clear(); subgridsStatus.clear(); }
